newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds were weaker at the close in very thin trade.

One trader noted that swap rates rose, especially in the short maturities, which weighed on cash bonds. The Swiss National Bank added liquidity to the money market on Tuesday but overall the market was quiet.

The market's thinness likely exaggerated the reaction to moves in the short end where prices of three-month EuroSwiss futures fell sharply relative to long bonds. Some traders saw reduced scope for Swiss short-term rates to fall further, given the softer tone in the Swiss franc versus the German mark.
Conf futures CONFc1 down nine at 120.64.
Euro Swiss francs FESc1 down six at 98.53.
